snippet: Consumer borrowing climbed to a high in May, propelled by a surge in auto and student loans.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports consumer borrowing rose $16.1 billion in May to $3.4 trillion, up from gain of $21.4 billion in April.
lead_paragraph: Consumer borrowing climbed to a high in May, propelled by a surge in auto and student loans.

headline.main: Consumer Borrowing Hits a Record $3.4 Trillion
headline.print_headline: Consumer Borrowing Hit a Record $3.4. Trillion in May
